headline: Biden Meet Putin June
summary: President Joe Biden and Russian President Vladimir Putin will meet at a summit in Geneva, Switzerland on June 16, the White House confirmed Tuesday. The meeting, proposed by Biden in anApril phone call, will be the two leaders’ first face-to-face meeting since Biden’s inauguration. It also comes at the end of Biden’s first international trip, in which he willvisit the U.K. and Belgium for the G-7 and NATO summits. Tensions are high between the U.S. and Russia, due to Russia’smilitary buildup on the Ukrainian border; thepoisoning and imprisonmentof opposition leader Alexei Navalny; theColonial Pipeline hack, allegedly carried out by a Russian-based cybercriminal group; Russia’sindifferencetowards Belarus’ recent andwidely-criticized arrest of a journalist; U.S. sanctions on Russia overelection interference and the SolarWinds hack; Russiannucleardeployments; and strong language used by the two leaders, includingBiden calling Putin a "killer."Coverage was mostly balanced across the spectrum and was displayed more prominently in left- and center-rated outlets.
